label: 135. Bond between James B. Heyward and William C. Heyward -- January 10, 1852
description: Bond for $11,200 between James B. Heyward and William C. Heyward.  Near copy of No. 134.  2p. January 10, 1852.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: BOND-Sold by A. E. Miller.  State of South-Carolina.  KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS, THAT I, James B. Heyward of Charleston and State aforesaid am held and firmly bound unto William C Heyward of St Bartholomews Parish and State aforesaid in the full and just sum of Eleven thousand, two hundred dollars to be paid unto the said William C Heyward his certain Attorney, Executors or Administrators, or Assigns: To which payment well and truly to be made and done I bind myself and each and every of my Heirs, Executors and Administrators, jointly and severally, firmly by these Presents. Sealed with my Seal and dated the tenth day of January in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and fifty two and in the Seventy Sixth year of the Independence of the United States of America. THE CONDITION of the above Obligation is such, That if the above bound James B. Heyward his Heirs, Executors, or Administrators, shall and do well and truly pay, or cause to be paid, unto the above-named William C Heyward his certain Attorney, Executors or Administrators, or Assigns, the full and just sum of Five thousand, Six hundred dollars with legal interest thereon, payable annually until the whole principal sum is paid on or before the tenth day of January which will be in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and fifty four without fraud or further delay, then the above Obligation to be void and of none effect, or else to remain in full force and virtue. SEALED AND DELIVERED IN THE PRESENCE OF Wm C Bee [End Page 1] Charleston 12th January 1853 Recd from Jas B Heyward Ex. by hand of Mr E Barnwell Jr Three hundred and ninety two dollars in full for one years interest on within Bond to 10 inst  Wm C Heyward Ex Wm Heyward Jr in Trust for Mrs S Heyward. Mr Wm C Bee & Co  $392.  Charleston 10 Jany. 1854 Recd from Jas B Heyward Esq by the hands of Mr E Barnwell Jr Three hundred and ninety two dolls in full for one years int on within Bond to date W C Heyward Ex Wm Heyward Jr Trust for Mrs S Heyward. Re W C Bee & Co  $392.  Charleston 12 Jany. 1855 Recd from J B Heyward Esq by the hands of Mr E Barnwell for Three hundred and ninety two Dolls in full for one years (page cutï¿½)  $392.-  Charleston 12 Jany. Inst Recd from Jas B Heyward Esqr by the hand of Ed Barnwell Jr Three hundred and ninety two dolls in full for one yrs int to 10 inst on within Bond W C Heyward Ex Wm Heyward in Trust for Mrs Sarah Heyward. W C Bee & Co  $392.-  Charleston 10 Jany 1857 Recd from Jas B Heyward by the hand of Ed Barnwell Jr Three hundred and ninety two dollars in full for one years interest to date on within Bond Wm C Heyward Ex. Wm Heyward in Trust for Mrs Sarah Heyward. Wm C Bee & Co  $392.  Charleston 19th Jan. 1858 Recd from Jas. B. Heyward by the hand of Ed. Barnwell Jr Three hundred and ninety two dollars in full for one years interest to 10th inst on within Bond Wm C. Heyward Ex Est Wm Heyward in trust for Mrs Sarah Heyward per Wm C. Bee & Co per T. S. Oxlade  $392  Received of Jas B Heyward by the hands of Edward Barnwell Jr. Charleston January 14th 1859 three hundred and ninety two dollars in full for one yrs int to 10th inst on within bond Wm C Heyward Ex. Wm Heyward in trust for Mrs Sarah Heyward pr John S Bee for Wm C. Bee & CO  $392-  Recd. Charleston Jan. 10th 1860 from James B. Heyward by the hands of Messrs. Ed Barnwell [?] Fifty six hundred dollars in full for within bond also three hundred and ninety two dollars for one yrs. int on same to 10th inst Wm C Heyward Ex Est. Wm Heyward in Trust for Mrs Sarah Heyward pr. John S Bee for Wm C Bee & Co.    [cover flap:] James B Heyward Bond condition $5,600 To Wm. C. Heyward    [upside down section:] For valuable consideration I do hereby assign transfer and set even to Wm C Heyward Executor of Wm Heyward in Trust for Mrs Sarah Heyward, the within Bond, with the monies now due, and to grow due thereon. Witness my hand and Seal this fourteenth day of January 1852. Wm. C. Heyward. Signed and Sealed in the presence of Wm C Bee  [End Page 2]
